comment: Light and sweet.  Drinks super easy for the high proof, lots of wood character.  The floral of the single barrel recipe stands out more than I expected.

Must proof it down, even at just 107.6

Nose: Cherry, Floral, Oak, Caramel

Taste: Dry and hot, had trouble getting flavors. After water, got some green apple flavor.

Finish: Long and dry
Had this at a charity event's cash bar. Absolutely lives up to the hype.

On the nose, nutmeg, vanilla, and sour baked apples. Spice immediately on the tongue, the tingle lingers throughout. Baking spices, wood, leather, cider, muddled berries. Slight bitter aftertaste. Lots going on. 8/18/17

Tasted like a higher proof version of the regular small batch (which is a good thing). However, I'd rather have the regular small batch at its price than this LE bottling at its price. 

(Whiskey Down, Las Vegas, 10/19/2017)
Lots of vanilla, caramelized sugars, and oak.  Flavor of candied oak and vanilla with a spicy oak finish that lasts and lasts.  Almost a hint of herbal wintergeen.
Amazing bourbon. I sold this bottle to a friend and I will regret it forever.

This was good, but good in the way that many Four Roses selects are. Now that's not a bad thing, it's just that I've got a Binny's OBSO that I like just as much and it was $55 without having to deal the furious bubble of hype surrounding this one. Good, but I'm not sure what makes it stand out as a LE. Miss you, Jimmy.

Nose: Carmel, apple cider 

Palate: wheat, sugar spice, berries, Carmel, vanilla, sweet and spicy - extremely well balanced- all flavors and spices are equally represented at equal and appropriate times. Very very good. 

Finish: spicy, oily, long- perfectly aged.
Nice aroma. Bursting flavor. Smooth cask strength. Twenty eight

Vanilla & apple nose with notes of oak. Sweet gentle vanilla, butterscotch & juicy dark fruit flavor with a hint of spice. Soft spicey finish. Vanilla lingering flavor with a touch of heat. 
$13 for a 2oz pour, The Common Table, Dallas. FYI, they now know that they made a mistake on the price...

In rocks glass. Almost muted floral and fruit aroma. Light but strong taste. Extremely high flavor efficiency. Appley sweet like Calvados. Almost eternal finish. Easily one of the best Bourbons I've had to date.

Four Roses Al Young 50th Anniversary was likely my favorite pour of 2017. It is a perfect balance of dark cherries, vanilla, and oak. While it is barrel strength.. The heat is not overwhelming, but makes for a long and smooth finish. Highly recommended.
One of my favorites from 2017. So much vanilla, very smooth.

Wow. the nose on this is amazing. A bouquet of flowers initially followed by honey and caramel. Keep in mind this is after letting it rest for about 5 minutes. Packed with flavors of camel, honey, hits of oak. tastes sweet in general. This would be your special occasion sipper. Definitely one of my top five. I paid through the nose on this one, but it was worth it.  Tried it neat.
Glorious....just glorious. There’s a reason for the insane price. One of the best
Loved everything about this, wished I would of ordered this over the 16’ Birthday Bourbon.  3/21/18 on Bourbon Trail trip in Louisville.
Doesnt get much better than this!
Would buy if it wasn’t so expensive

Nose: subtle cinnamon and ethanol a little cloves and maybe some citrus

Mouthfeel: a little oily and soft

Palate: starts soft with some honey and sweetness then flairs into the nose with spice and heat that never gets out of control 

Finish: long and lingering with cinnamon and oak
Love, love love.  Smooth and delicious through whole drink.  BUY!!!

Had the pleasure of tasting this at Jack Rose Dining Saloon in Washington, DC during a Four Roses tasting event. Very complex palette with hints of vanilla, oak, spice and maybe butterscotch.  A good bit of fire on the finish.  One of a kind.

I've had the opportunity to sample a few of these releases and have yet to be disappointed. This year's release in particular I really enjoyed. So I was very thankful to have the opportunity to sample this 2017 release!! 

Here are the components that went into this release:

 5% 23-year OBSV, 25% 15-year OBSK, 50% 13-year OESV, and 20% 12-year OBSF. 

On to the tasting:

It enters with perfect balance and mouthfeel. An explosion of flavors.... classic cinnamon, nutmeg, pepper, and oak... dark fruits and caramel on the mid palette... The finish is endless adding tobacco and leather with lingering spice on the tongue... It's outstanding!

This one fully lives up to it's hype and was an absolute pleasure to taste!

Cheers All
Fruity on the nose. Zesty and sweet with light oak. Lots of fruit and even some smoke. Sweeter than I’d expect. Pretty incredible.

The nose starts with vanilla and baking spices, followed up with oak, custard and a soft floral fruitiness. The palate is full of cinnamon and baking spices, with oak and vanilla balancing it out while followed by a floral tone, sweet fruit, caramel and buttered bread. The finish is long and peppery with creamy vanilla and oak that fades and fades.
So smooth. Def worth the price of admission
One of the very best bourbons I’ve had the please to try
One of the best pours you could have. Divine greatness
